item.title: Creating the image (disk.raw)
item.description: Creating the image (disk.raw) The fastest way of doing this (less than 1 hour “7min”) is to use AWS and chose the c4.8xlarge instance, at the moment of writhing this, is an instance with 36 vCPU / 60 RAM, the important thing to check for is the amount of cores not really the memory. After finishing building, stop or terminate the build instance, mainly because is a very expensive and in best scenario you just want to do all this in less than 1 hour.

item.title: test
item.description: DRAFT Download the image: disk.tar.gz The image can be uploaded directly to AWS, Google compute engine or to test it within Virtualbox need to convert it to VDI format: $ VBoxManage convertfromraw disk.raw ec2.vdi --format VDI The image size is 2GB, once the image is in VDI format it can be resized: $ VBoxManage modifyhd ec2.vdi --resize 20480 20480 will create a 20GB disk Once the image has been booted it can be resized within zfs: https://nbari.

item.title: What is Fabrik
item.description: What is Fabrik ? A tool for creating and managing jails. Why ? FreeBSD is a beast. Unfortunately few are capable of taking advantage all the benefits and capabilities available within it. It is a fact that for having a proper setup some work needs to be done, you don’t get diamonds by just putting carbon in the microwave and wait for a couple of minutes. The idea behind Fabrik is to simplify the initial/bootstrap work (custom kernel + ZFS) and come with a ready to work image that can be used out of the box and create jails on demand.
